result.execSummary:
Brian A Bragg was extradited to another county, state or jurisdiction. Extradition means Brian A Bragg was accused or convicted of an offense in another county, state or jurisdiction and was taken there to face their charge(s) or conviction.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Brian A Bragg

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Original Bond returned by Sherrif's Department unsigned / not posted.
Prosecutor Lyndsey A.B. Brunette and Defendant, Brian A Bragg, in custody, appeared with Attorney Christine Kuczynski.  Extradition to go forward, no further proceedings, closed

Copy of extradition request from State of Louisiana-additional information
located in unscannable drawer as some documents did not scan

Copy of extradition request from State of Louisiana
located in unscannable drawer as some documents did not scan
Status conference on February 12, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

District Attorney Lyndsey A Boon Brunette appeared on behalf of the State;  Defendant appeared in person via video conference from Clark County Jail with Attorney Kuczynski appearing in person in court. Mr Bragg still remains in custody as the State of Louisiana has not picked him up. State provides paper work from that state indicating that is in the works. Defense requests release-Court adjourns matter until day time limits run out  Status conference scheduled for February 12, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Status conference on February 5, 2015 at 08:30 am.

District Attorney Lyndsey A Boon Brunette appeared on behalf of the State;    Defendant appeared in person via video conference from Clark County Jail with Attorney Christine Kuczynski appearing in person in court.  State asking for a 60 day extension - granted  Status conference scheduled for February 5, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Status conference on December 11, 2014 at 02:20 pm.

Prosecutor, Lyndsey A.B. Brunette, and Defendant, Brian A Bragg, appeared via video from Clark Co Jail with Attorney Christine Kuczynski appearing in court  Requesting a Warrant from the Governor.  Status conference scheduled for December 11, 2014 at 02:20 pm.
Status conference on November 26, 2014 at 11:30 am.

Prosecutor Lyndsey A.B. Brunette and Defendant, Brian A Bragg, appeared in custody pro se.    State asking for a $20,000 cash bond,    Defendant advised of right to an attorney.  Status conference scheduled for November 26, 2014 at 11:30 am.
